result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben J Murry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. No contact with the victim M.K., A.K. or any members of their family members including children. If the defendant becomes the adjudicated father of A.K.'s child he is to comply with family court orders. Contact must be approved by agent. No contact with any known drug dealers or users including anyone who users marijuana. Mental health assessment to be completed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:52 PM Defendant Ruben J Murry in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston and Michael Forella III in court for Ruben J Murry.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Victim present in court. Matter set for JT today but parties indicated prior to going on the record that the case is resolved. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with a plea hearing today but Defense requests another date for sentencing. 

State pits the offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant.

21CF364 sole count- NO CONTEST.

22CF378 sole count- NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaints.

9:55 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ruben J Murry in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston and Atty Michael Forella in court for Ruben J Murry. Court Reporter: Saige Smith.

ADDRESS INFO for Ruben J Murry
Current: 1527 North Wisconsin st, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 05-17-2022)
Prior: 2337 Thor Ave, Racine, WI 53405 United States

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
*AMENDED 04-07-22 DEFENDANT MAY HAVE A GPS EXCEPTION FOR EMPLOYMENT PURPOSES, MUST VERIFY HOURS WITH RCAP*
NG plea entered.

8:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ruben J Murry in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Ruben J Murry. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense asks to modify GPS conditions to allow employment.
State gives concerns to any bond modification.
BTC: Motion to modify bond granted, defendant may have a GPS exception for employment.
